title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, the acceptance of matching funds for approved projects, and amendments to Commission personnel matters. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 (42 U.S.C. 3121 note; Public Law 105-277) is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status and the option for non-government members to waive compensation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow federal government employees to waive compensation and appoint necessary personnel for the Commission's duties. Additionally, the Economic Development Committee section is redesignated as section 311. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 (42 U.S.C. 3121 note; Public Law 105-277) is amended to redesignate the Economic Development Committee section as section 311 and change "shall" to "may" in section 311. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to designate special functions to the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to designate special functions to the Denali Commission, including a training program for careers in infrastructure development and long-term stability in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects, management training, and initiatives for Alaskan youths. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 designates special functions for the Commission, including initiatives for Alaskan youths, training for infrastructure careers, and teacher housing assistance in rural Alaska. Amounts allocated to the Commission remain available until expended. The Commission may assist in housing development activities, including acquisition, rehabilitation, new construction of housing, and multisite rehabilitation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
